p: The VEEV TC-83 strain is the only licensed live-attenuated vaccine available to protect horses in endemic regions. This vaccine strain has been developed by passaging the Trinidad donkey (TrD) IA/B strains 83 times in guinea pig heart cells [ 112]. Genetic characterization of the TC-83 strain indicates that the attenuation phenotype relies on only two point mutations (nucleotide position 3 in 5'-noncoding region and amino acid position 120 in E2 glycoprotein) [ 113, 114]. Currently, there is no licensed human VEEV vaccine, but TC-83 live-attenuated vaccine is used for laboratory workers and military personnel [ 115].
